HomePage.title: Microsoft Entra OAuth Playground
HomePage.description: Explore OAuth 2.0 and OpenID Connect flows end-to-end with a guided, step-by-step experience. Configure your Microsoft Entra app settings, generate authorization URLs, and walk through PKCE creation, callbacks, and token exchanges. See the exact requests and responses at each stage, decode and validate tokens, and understand key claims and security checks.

authorize.description: We build the authorization URL including your client_id, redirect_uri, scopes, optional state and nonce, and PKCE parameters. You can also set response_mode, prompt, and login_hint to influence how the identity provider returns results or how the sign-in experience behaves. Click 'Open popup' to sign in and consent. After completing sign-in, the popup will redirect back and step 5 will auto-fill with the code.

settings.userProvidedDescription: These fields are configured by you and are used to build the authorization request.

help.responseType: OAuth response_type parameter; for PKCE it is 'code'.
help.state: Opaque value to maintain state between request and callback; helps prevent CSRF.
help.nonce: A string to associate a client session with an ID token; helps mitigate replay attacks.
help.responseMode: Where the response should be returned (query or form_post).
help.prompt: Controls the behavior: login, consent, select_account, or none.
help.loginHint: Prefill the username or sign-in hint (e.g., email).
help.authUrlPreview: The full authorization URL that will open in the popup.

callApi.description: Call a protected API with the access token. Adjust the endpoint and send the GET request to see the response.

help.apiEndpoint: HTTP endpoint to call with the access token (e.g., Microsoft Graph).
help.apiHeaders: HTTP headers used for the API call (includes Authorization).
help.apiResponse: Raw response from the API call (pretty-printed if JSON).

callback.description: Inspect the callback URL or POST body for the authorization code, state, or any returned errors after sign-in.

help.callbackUrl: The full callback URL captured from the popup after sign-in.
help.callbackBody: If response_mode=form_post, the identity provider sends parameters in the POST body.
help.extractedCode: The authorization code extracted from the callback parameters.
help.extractedState: The state value extracted from the callback parameters (if set).
help.error: Short error code returned by the authorization server (the 'error' parameter).
help.errorUri: Optional URI with more information about the error (the 'error_uri' parameter).
help.errorDescription: Optional human-readable description of the error (the 'error_description' parameter).

pkce.description: PKCE secures public clients. Click the Generate button (left of the Code Verifier input) to create a high-entropy code_verifier and its code_challenge (S256 by default).

help.codeVerifier: High-entropy random string kept secret by the client (PKCE).
help.codeChallenge: Base64url-encoded SHA-256 hash of the code_verifier (S256).

tokens.description: Request tokens from the token endpoint and inspect both the request and response.

help.tokenEndpointPreview: The full token endpoint URL that will be used to exchange the authorization code.
help.tokenRequest: The POST body (x-www-form-urlencoded) used to exchange the code for tokens.

validate.title: Validate tokens
validate.description: This guide walks through how to validate the ID and access tokens you received: first, how signature validation works (kid -> metadata -> jwks -> verify), then the common claim checks you should perform (aud, iss, tid, nonce, scopes/roles, exp, nbf, iat).

validateUi.graphWarning: Access tokens for Microsoft Graph (aud {aud}) typically cannot be signature-validated by this client. Only Microsoft Graph can validate their signatures.

id.exp: exp must be in the future
id.nbfIat: nbf/iat must be <= now (with small skew)

access.exp: exp must be in the future
access.nbfIat: nbf/iat must be <= now (with small skew)
access.msGraph: (Microsoft Graph audience; only Graph can verify signatures)

settings.description: Configure your client settings for the authorization code flow.
settings.userProvidedDescription: These fields are configurable by you and are used to build the authorization request.
settings.localStorageNotice: These values will be saved in your browser's local storage for convenience.
settings.resolvedDescription: These values are derived from the tenant and other inputs. They are shown for reference and cannot be changed here.

help.tenantId: Directory (tenant) GUID of your Entra ID instance.
help.clientId: Application (client) ID of your app registration.
help.scopes: Space-separated scopes to request (e.g., openid profile offline_access api://.../scope.read).
help.authEndpoint: OAuth 2.0 v2 authorize endpoint. Tenant is substituted in {tenant}.
help.tokenEndpoint: OAuth 2.0 v2 token endpoint. Tenant is substituted in {tenant}.
help.redirectUri: Callback URL for this app. Must match the redirect URI in the app registration.
help.streamlined: Automatically runs steps and hides advanced fields to speed up the demo.
help.pkceEnabled: PKCE is recommended for public clients and optional for confidential clients.

errors.tenantIdInvalid: Tenant is required and must be a GUID
errors.clientIdRequired: Client ID is required and must be a GUID
errors.clientIdInvalid: Client ID must be a GUID
errors.redirectUriInvalid: Redirect URI must be a valid http(s) URL

decode.description: Access and ID tokens are JWTs. Click 'Decode' to view the header and payload claims in a readable form.

help.accessToken: Access token to call APIs. Shown as a JWT string.
help.idToken: ID token representing the user identity. Shown as a JWT string.
help.accessHeader: Decoded JWT header of the access token.
help.accessPayload: Decoded JWT payload of the access token.
help.idHeader: Decoded JWT header of the ID token.
help.idPayload: Decoded JWT payload of the ID token.

notes.accessHeaderNonce: This access token header contains a nonce field. This is a provider-specific JOSE header and is unrelated to the OIDC nonce claim, which is validated in the ID token payload.

settings.flowIntro: High-level overview of the Authorization Code + PKCE flow.
settings.flowDiagram:
Client (Browser)
   |
   | 1) Generate code_verifier + code_challenge (S256)
   v
Authorize Endpoint ------------------------------>
   |   GET .../authorize?client_id=...&redirect_uri=...
   |        &response_type=code&scope=...&state=...
   |        &code_challenge=...&code_challenge_method=S256
   |
   | 2) User signs in and consents
   v
Redirect (Callback) <------------------------------
   |   http(s)://your-app/callback/auth-code?code=...&state=...
   |
   | 3) Exchange code for tokens with code_verifier
   v
Token Endpoint ----------------------------------->
   |   POST grant_type=authorization_code
   |        &client_id=...
   |        &code=...
   |        &redirect_uri=...
   |        &code_verifier=...
   |
   | 4) Receive tokens (access_token, id_token, ... )
   v
Protected API (e.g., Graph) --------------------->
   |   Authorization: Bearer <access_token>
   v
  Response

StepAuthentication.description: Choose how the client will authenticate to the token endpoint when exchanging the authorization code.

help.clientAuthMethod: Choose how the client authenticates to the token endpoint when exchanging the code.
help.clientSecret: Your confidential client secret. For demo purposes this value stays in memory only (not persisted).
help.privateKeyPem: Keep this secure! This private key is used to sign the client assertion JWT.
help.publicKeyPem: The public key corresponding to your private key.
help.certificatePem: Upload this certificate to Entra ID under App Registration → Certificates & secrets.
help.thumbprintSha1: Use this as the Key ID (kid). This matches what you see in Entra ID portal.
help.clientAssertionKid: This should match the "Thumbprint" shown in Entra ID → App Registration → Certificates & secrets
help.assertionClaims: Preview of the JWT claims that will be used in the client_assertion parameter.
help.testAssertion: A test client_assertion JWT generated with your private key.
help.decodedAssertion: The decoded header and payload of the test JWT for verification purposes.

placeholders.privateKeyPem: Click "Generate Key Pair" to create a private key
placeholders.publicKeyPem: Generated automatically with the private key
placeholders.certificatePem: Click "Generate Certificate" to create a self-signed certificate
placeholders.assertionClaims: Click "Preview Claims" to see the JWT claims
placeholders.testAssertion: Click "Generate Test Assertion" to create a test JWT
placeholders.decodedAssertion: Generated automatically when test assertion is created

generateKeyPair.title: Step 1: Generate RSA Key Pair
generateKeyPair.description: Generate a 2048-bit RSA key pair for signing the client assertion JWT.

generateCertificate.title: Step 2: Create Self-Signed Certificate
generateCertificate.description: Create a self-signed X.509 certificate to upload to Microsoft Entra ID. The certificate thumbprint can be used as the kid.

configureKid.title: Step 3: Key ID (kid) - Auto-populated
configureKid.description: The certificate thumbprint (SHA-1) is automatically used as the Key ID and matches what you see in Entra ID portal.

previewClaims.title: Step 4: Preview Client Assertion Claims
previewClaims.description: Preview the JWT claims that will be used in the client_assertion parameter.

testAssertion.title: Step 5: Test Generate Signed Assertion
testAssertion.description: Generate a test client_assertion JWT to verify it's working. The actual assertion will be created when calling the token endpoint.

note.label: Note:
note.body: When you click "Exchange Code for Tokens" in the next step, a fresh client_assertion will be automatically generated and sent to the token endpoint. The private key stays secure and never leaves your browser.

errors.keyPairRequired: Please generate a key pair first.
errors.missingClientConfig: Please configure client ID and token endpoint first.
errors.missingKeyOrConfig: Please generate a key pair and configure settings first.

overview.flowIntro: High-level overview of the Authorization Code + PKCE flow for public clients (no client secret).
overview.flowDiagram:
Client (SPA)
   |
   | 1) Generate code_verifier + code_challenge (S256)
   v
Authorize Endpoint ------------------------------>
   |   GET .../authorize?client_id=...&redirect_uri=...
   |        &response_type=code&scope=...&state=...
   |        &code_challenge=...&code_challenge_method=S256
   |
   | 2) User signs in and consents
   v
Redirect (Callback) <------------------------------
   |   https://app/callback?code=...&state=...
   |
   | 3) Exchange code for tokens (no client secret)
   v
Token Endpoint ----------------------------------->
   |   POST grant_type=authorization_code
   |        &client_id=...
   |        &code=...
   |        &redirect_uri=...
   |        &code_verifier=...
   |
   | 4) Receive tokens (access_token, id_token, ... )
   v
Protected API (e.g., Graph) --------------------->
   |   Authorization: Bearer <access_token>
   v
  Response

overview.flowIntro: High-level overview of the Authorization Code flow for confidential clients (with client authentication).
overview.flowDiagram:
Client (Web/App)
   |
   | 1) (Optional) Generate code_verifier + code_challenge (PKCE)
   v
Authorize Endpoint ------------------------------>
   |   GET .../authorize?client_id=...&redirect_uri=...
   |        &response_type=code&scope=...&state=...
   |        &code_challenge=...&code_challenge_method=S256
   |
   | 2) User signs in and consents
   v
Redirect (Callback) <------------------------------
   |   https://app/callback?code=...&state=...
   |
   | 3) Exchange code for tokens with client auth
   v
Token Endpoint ----------------------------------->
   |   POST grant_type=authorization_code
   |        &client_id=...
   |        &code=...
   |        &redirect_uri=...
   |        &client_secret=... OR client_assertion=...
   |        &code_verifier=... (if PKCE)
   |
   | 4) Receive tokens (access_token, id_token, ... )
   v
Protected API (e.g., Graph) --------------------->
   |   Authorization: Bearer <access_token>
   v
  Response

help.authEndpoint: OAuth 2.0 v2 authorize endpoint. Tenant is substituted in {tenant}.
help.tokenEndpoint: OAuth 2.0 v2 token endpoint. Tenant is substituted in {tenant}.

disabled.title: PKCE
disabled.description: PKCE is disabled for this flow. You can enable it in Settings.

overview.flowIntro: High-level overview of the Client Credentials flow (app-only, no user).
overview.flowDiagram:
Client (Daemon/App)
   |
   | 1) Configure client authentication (secret or certificate)
   v
Token Endpoint ----------------------------------->
   |   POST grant_type=client_credentials
   |        &client_id=...
   |        &scope=...
   |        &client_secret=... OR client_assertion=...
   |
   | 2) Receive access_token (app-only)
   v
Protected API (e.g., Graph) --------------------->
   |   Authorization: Bearer <access_token>
   v
  Response
